explains: adj. 大得惊人的，令人吃惊的
v. 摇摇晃晃地走，蹒跚；使震惊，使大吃一惊；使交错，使错开（stagger 的现在分词）

sentences.en: What are you doing fooling with such a staggering sum of money?
sentences.cn: 你拿这么惊人的一大笔钱瞎折腾什么？

sentences.en: Piot said the disease has already reached staggering proportions since first being identified in 1981.
sentences.cn: 皮奥特说，这种疾病自1981年被首次发现以来，已经达到了惊人的比例。

sentences.en: With seats at US$125, gate receipts alone were a staggering $10,000,000.
sentences.cn: 座位价格为125美元，仅门票收入就高达1000万美元。
